ratings.question_text: I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: What is the name of your TA?
comments: Ashley DuVal
Ashley DuVal

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: I hope that this course is offered in the future because Ina Vandebroek is a fabulous asset.

While the course load was not abundant it was heavier than other one credit classes. Also due to logistical issues it took a while to set up the class with a classesv2 server which made receiving, reading, and commenting on all articles before class quite challenging.
Learning about Ina's field experience and research

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: This class needed more structure then it had this semester.

The lectures sometimes felt repetitive and the class timing (monday evenings) was difficult with no snacks or mid-class break. I would also liked to have taken advantage of Ina's NYBG connections for a field component or visit to the gardens to see how her work is done there.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Ashley was very helpful.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: I am very interested in the subject of ethnobotany and I think it is useful for all environmental degrees to think about the intersections between people/anthropology and plants/botany.
I'm interested in the topic but my academic pursuits at FES were not in this area. Someday I may pursue the topic further.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I took this course because I am really interested in learning about Ethnobotany and how research is done in the field.
I'm interested in traditional medicine and herbs.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: I would have liked to have the original class proposed because I think it would have offered more. However, I enjoyed this class and learned a lot from it.
Yes

The focus of the course was different from what I expected. The literature we read was mostly centered on research in South America. I would have enjoyed a broader survey of different worldviews and relationships of people to plants rather than the methods of research.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes

Somewhat. Though I found Ina's research and conversation with my classmates fascinating, I'm having trouble identifying what I took away from the class. I had a chance to explore my own research and practice but I'm not sure I learned new information about technique or theory in the field.

No; I think I wanted to learn more about the useful plant families, but the focus of the course was more on the methods of research. Since I do not expect to conduct ethnobotanical research, the emphasis of the course was not as useful to me as it would be to students who do go to the field.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: I could talk over discussion points with a partner and in doing so discuss my thoughts on the reading with a classmate one-on-one, which is useful.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: This is a new course so there is room to tailor the syllabus to cover more topics (hard because of Ina's visa complications this time around) or add in a field component.
